file_content.text: The Killiks have plagued Alderaan for millennia. Thanks to the relic, we finally have the upper hand.
Here's the relic. I hope it contains the Killik records you expected.
Finally, it's in my hands. Our Killik experts will be thrilled.
I appreciate your haste. You certainly shamed those pathetic researchers of mine, wherever they are.
I ran into the researchers. They're in rough shape.
Actually, I found your team.
Let them rot. They've proven their ineptitude.
Anything for House Thul.
We owe the Empire much, and we will not forget.
Did you forget to mention that the mountain was swarming with Killiks?
There were Killiks everywhere.
Believe me, I had no idea. Perhaps the hive mind knew of the relic's importance. At any rate, they can't stop us now.
I shame many.
Color me impressed.
Soon we'll drive the Killiks into submission. Then Alderaan will finally bow to House Thul.
The relic is close. I can almost feel it.
This is unacceptable. I sent researchers out two, three hours ago, and still they haven't returned.
We shouldn't have to tolerate such incompetence, my lord. Makes the stomach churn.
Not an efficient bone in their bodies.
Service like this... I won't pay them. House Thul demands higher standards.
Perhaps you could assist where those indolent researchers failed. I need that relic. I need it now.
Relic?
What do I get out of this?
I'll double the researchers' fee. Anything for the artifact.
Your team could be dead.
Dead, alive, they're still failures. Only the relic matters.
It holds ancient texts detailing a time when Killiks ruled Alderaan. Records of Oroboro, the Killiks' Castle Lands, their rise and their fall.
With the relic's information, we could potentially drive back the Killiks. Or control them.
If your plan fails or enrages the Killiks, it will be on your head.
You better be right.
Nothing is certain, my lord. But I promise I won't fail the Empire.
An army of obedient insects would suit the Empire nicely.
I like the sound of that.
Yes, my lord. We could drive them against House Organa. The Killiks would leave nothing behind.
With the hive on our side, the Republic would be forced to abandon Alderaan.
Killiks could prove useful.
Precisely, agent. Why sacrifice Imperial lives when insects do just as nicely?
One wrong move and you'll enrage the hive. The Imps won't like that.
Sounds risky.
House Thul is aware of the inherent risks, hunter.
Control Killiks? You're crazy.
Yudin Thul never jokes. Our top scientists agree on the artifact's potential.
Why bother controlling the Killiks when we can slaughter them all and be done with it?
Better to kill them all.
That seems a tad harsh, even if it could be done.
Everything rests on the relic's recovery. And I've wasted enough time waiting on my inept researchers.
Perhaps you can repair their blunder. Recover the relic?
I'll find the relic.
You'd best be right.
If I weren't confident, I'd be in my estate, sipping Alderaanian brandy.
The relic lies among ruins atop the nearby mountain. If you see my researchers, feel free to push them down the mountainside.
No, Thul. [Refuse quest]
Hmm. Perhaps my researchers will return with the relic anyway. Who am I kidding?
Blasted researchers. What's keeping them?
